Package planetarium.solarsystem

Class SolarSystem

java.lang.Object
planetarium.solarsystem.SolarSystem
public class SolarSystem extends Object
Represent a solar system : a star, his planets and the planets moons.

  • Constructor Details

    • SolarSystem

      public SolarSystem(Position starPosition, long starMass)
      SolarSystem constructor.

      The system is instantiated with its star's parameters.

      Parameters:
      starPosition - the position of the system's star relative to an arbitrary origin.
      starMass - the mass of the star.
      See Also:
      • Position

    • SolarSystem

      public SolarSystem(long x, long y, long starMass)
      SolarSystem constructor. The system is instantiated with its star's parameters but receives coordinates instead of an instance of Position.
      Parameters:
      x - the offset along the x-axis of the star relative to an arbitrary origin.
      y - the offset along the y-axis of the star relative to an arbitrary origin.
      starMass - the mass of the star.

  • Method Details

    • getStar

      public Star getStar()
      Getter method for the star.
      Returns:
      the star instance.
      See Also:
      • Star

    • getCenterOfMass

      public Position getCenterOfMass()
      Calculates the center of mass of the system.
      Returns:
      the position of the center of mass of the system
      See Also:
      • Position

    • findCelestialBody

      public CelestialBody findCelestialBody(String identifier)
      Finds a celestial body (star, planet or moon) given its identifier.
      Parameters:
      identifier - the celestial body unique identifier
      Returns:
      the instance of the celestial body, may return null if it does not exist.
      See Also:
      • CelestialBody

    • detectCollisions

      public boolean detectCollisions()
      Checks for all types of possible collisions in the system, return true if found.
      Returns:
      true if there are possible collisions, false if not.

    • findPath

      public String findPath(String startIdentifier, String endIdentifier) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Finds the path from a celestial body in the universe to another. Example: " S1P1M1 > S1P1 > S1 > S1P3 "
      Parameters:
      startIdentifier - Identifier of the celestial body at the start of the path.
      endIdentifier - Identifier of the celestial body at the end of the path.
      Returns:
      A string that represents the path between the two celestial bodies.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException
